name: [thio]carbamate-compound production | [thio]carbamate-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1366/documentation

This dataset represents the production of (thio)carbamate-compunds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;Production of (thio)carbamate-compunds including materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions..

From reception of precursors (acetaldehyde, acetic anhydride, ammonia, aniline, benzyl chloride, bromine, calcium carbide, carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, chlorine, dimethyl sulfate, ethanol, ethyl acetate, ethylenediamine, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen, hydrogen cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, iodine, methanol, nitrobenzene, nitrogen, oxygen, phosgene, phophorus, propanal, sodium hydroxide, sulfur, sulfur trioxide, sulfuric acid, toluene, water decarbonised, and "water, salt, sole") at the factory gate.

This activity ends with  (thio)carbamate-compunds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Carbamates are compounds (mostly insecticides) with an N-methyl amide functional group or an amide functional group with substituents besides methyl groups.;Thiocarbamates are herbicides with a carbamate structure where sulphur replaces one of the oxygens in the amide functional group. Carbamates are produced by reacting a chloroformate with an amine. If a thiochloroformate is used instead the product is a thiocarbamate.; ;The dataset [thio]carbamate-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of asulam, carbetamide, desmedipham, orbencarb, pirimicarb, and prosulfocarb.;;Asulam is produced in five steps from aniline:;C6H7N + C2H4O2 → C8H9NO + H2O;C8H9NO + ClSO3H → C8H8ClNO3S + H2O;C8H8ClNO3S + NH3 → C8H10N2O3S + HCl;C8H10N2O3S + C2H3ClO2 → C10H12N2O5S + HCl;C10H12N2O5S + NaOH → C8H10N2O4S + C2H3O2Na;Precursors that are used for the asulam production are chlorosulfonic acid (ClSO2OH) and methyl chloroformate (C2H3ClO2).;;Carbetamide is produced in five steps from acetaldehyde:;C2H4O + HCN → C3H5NO;C3H5NO + HCl + 2 H2O → C3H6O3 + NH4Cl;C3H6O3 + CH4O → C4H8O3 + H2O;C4H8O3 + C2H7N → C5H11O2N + CH4O;C5H11O2N + C7H5NO → C12H16N2O3;Precursors that are used for the carbetamide production are ethylamine (C2H7N) and phenyl isocyanate (C7H5NO).;;Desmedipham is produced in six steps from nitrobenzene:;C6H5NO2 + H2SO4 → C6H5NO5S + H2O;C6H5NO5S + 3 H2 → C6H7O3S + 2 H2O;C6H7NO3S + 3 NaOH → C6H6NONa + Na2SO3 + 2 H2O;C6H6NONa + H2SO4 → C6H7NO + NaHSO4;C6H7NO + C3H5ClO2 → C9H11NO3 + HCl;C9H11NO3 + C7H5NO → C16H16N2O4;Precursors that are used for the desmedipham production are phenyl isocyanate (C7H5NO) and ethyl chloroformate (C3H5ClO2).;;Orbencarb is produced in two steps from diethyl amine:;C4H11N + COS → C5H11NOS;C5H11NOS + C7H6ClBr → C12H16ClNOS + HBr;Precursors that are used for the orbencarb production are carbonyl sulfide (COS) and 2-chloro benzyl bromide (C7H6ClBr).;;Pirimicarb is produced in six steps from ethyl acetate:;2 C4H8O2 → C6H10O3 + C2H6O;C6H10O3 + H2O → C4H6O3 + C2H6O;C4H6O3 + CH3I → C5H8O3 + HI;C5H8O3 + C2H6O → C7H12O3 + H2O;C7H12O3 + C6H20N6SO4 → C8H14N3O + C2H6O + H2O + H2SO4;C8H14N3O + C3H6ClNO → C11H18N4O2 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the pirimicarb production are dimethylcarbamoyl chloride (C3H6ClNO), N,N-dimethyl guanidine sulfate (C6H20N6SO4), and methyl iodide (CH3I).;;Prosulfocarb is produced in three steps from propanal:;2 C3H6O + 2 H2 + NH3 → C6H15N + 2 H2O;C6H15N + CCl2O → C7H14ClNO + HCl;C7H14ClNO + C7H8S → C14H21NOS + HCl;A precursor that is used for the prosulfocarb production is benzyl mercaptan (C7H8S).;;Precursors:;;Benzyl mercaptan (C7H8S) is produced in two steps from hydrogen sulfide:;H2S + NaOH → NaSH + H2O;NaSH + C7H7Cl → C7H8S + NaCl;;Carbonyl sulfide (COS) is produced from carbon monoxide and sulfur:;CO + S → COS;;2-Chloro benzyl bromide (C7H6ClBr) is produced in two steps from toluene:;C7H8 + Cl2 → C7H7Cl + HCl;C7H7Cl + Br2 → C7H6ClBr + HBr;;Chlorosulfonic acid (ClSO2OH) is produced from hydrogen chloride and sulfur trioxide:;HCl + SO3 → ClSO2OH;;Dimethyl carbamoyl chloride (C3H6ClNO) is produced from phosgene and dimethyl amine:;C2H7N + CCl2O → C3H6ClNO + HCl;;N,N-Dimethyl guanidine sulfate (C6H20N6SO4) is produced in four steps from calcium carbide:;CaC2 + N2 + O2 → CaCN2 + CO2;CaCN2 + CO2 + H2O → CH2N2 + CaCO3;C2H7N + CH2N2 → C3H9N3;C3H9N3 + H2SO4 → C6H20N6SO4;;Ethylamine (C2H7N) is produced from ethanol and ammonia:;C2H6O + NH3 → C2H7N + H2O;;Ethyl chloroformate (C3H5ClO2) is produced from ethanol and phosgene:;C2H6O + CCl2O → C3H5ClO2 + HCl;;Methyl chloroformate (C2H3ClO2) is produced from methanol and phosgene:;CH4O + CCl2O → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;;Methyl iodide (CH3I) is produced from methanol and iodine:;10 CH4O + 5 I2 + 2 P → 10 CH3I + 2 H3PO4 + 2 H2O;;Phenyl isocyanate (C7H5NO) is produced from anilinie and phosgene:;C6H7N + CCl2O → C7H5NO + 2 HCl

exchanges.description:
[Thio]carbamates can have different modes of action. Asulam, which is a herbicide, acts as an inhibitor of 7,8-dihydro-pteroate synthetase (DHP); desmedipham, which is also a herbicide, acts as an inhibitor of photosynthesis at photosystem II site A; orbencarb and prosulfocarb, also herbicides, act as inhibitors of lipid synthesis, not ACCase inhibition; and Pirimicarb, which is an insecticide, acts as a cholinesterase inhibitor.

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
